content: knit purl and knit the next 35 stitches in pattern p2 k2 purling the purl bumps and knitting the knit vs turn the sock so the right ride outside is facing you and repeat a then repeat b you will work a and b a total of 15 times each you can keep a tally if that is most comfortable for you but you will soon notice that the slipped stitches on the edges are significantly larger than regular stitches and are easy to count see photo to the right you may wish to simply count those stitches periodically and stop when you have 15 on each side finishing after having completed step b you should now have a cylindrical tube for the leg with a rectangle hanging off of it for the back of the ankle/heel area of the foot the next step is to make a curved piece at the end of your rectangle to fit around the heel and change the entire direction of the sock it s a small but powerful element in the sock turning the heel we re going to abandon the ribbing for this part and for all but the top part of the sock from here on out the new element we ll add is called short row short row create the shaping we want with the right side outside facing you knit 21 stitches you ll have 15 stitches still on your left needle ssk k1 you have 12 stitches left unworked ssk = slip slip knit if this is new don t worry slip a stitch from the left to right needle as if you re going to knit it but don t do that again now put both stitches together back on the left needle knit the two of them together as if they were one the reason you don t just knit 2 © 2025 kiersten harrod all rights reserved go to www kierstenj com for more resources to help you be a better knitter page 3 of 7 together in the first place is because the slipping changes which leg of the knit stitch is at the front that s important because it sets up which direction the decrease leans in socks and many other pieces we often use matched decreases where they lean in opposite directions making a pretty symmetrical effect if we don t do the slipping the decrease won t lean correctly you ll see this more obviously later in the gusset and the toe sections turn your work so the wrong side inside is facing you slip 1 stitch as if to purl purl 7 p2tog p 1 you have 12 stitches left unworked this is a bit odd-looking right now but what you ve done is set yourself up to gradually work those unworked stitches back in
